text: Live at the Treehouse is a live-in-the-studio album recorded and released by Joe Firstman on Rock Ridge Music.Americana Daily "Joe Firstman - 'Live at the Treehouse'" The album includes rerecorded songs from previous albums,Rulmann, William. Live at the Treehouse at AllMusic but it also contains a new song, "Middle Ground."Antimusic "Joe Firstman Sets New Album Release" According to Mark McDermott of the Easy Reader News, the new recordings show Firstman's "transformation" as an artist from the "full band ensembles of his early years to just his voice, guitar, and songs alone on the stage," additionally remarking that the songs are written by a younger Firstman but performed by a slightly older and wiser artist.Mark McDermott, Easy Reader News, "The road- going of Joe Firstman" To give the recordings a live feel, Firstman sings and plays at the same time, and the album has no overdubs. Live at the Treehouse contains a number of guest performers, as indicated in the track list below. ==Track listing== # "The One That Makes You Happy" – 3:06 # "Phoenix Hotel" – 2:25 # "Fight Song" (featuring Brian Wright) – 2:33 # "Pretty Things" (featuring Tim Jones and Walker Young) – 2:51 # "Marlene and Her Sisters" (featuring Jamie Drake) – 2:23 # "Everything Is a Crime" (featuring Mike Vizcarra) – 2:48 # "Middle Ground" (featuring Jay Buchanan) – 3:04 # "Mrs. Rosenthal" – 3:08 # "Speak Your Mind" (iTunes Store exclusive) # "Crowded Town" (iTunes Store exclusive) ==References== Category:2010 albums Category:Joe Firstman albums
